intro: Hoffmannia lancistigma, commonly known as the narrow-lobed hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with lance-shaped lobes. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Hoffmannia lancistigma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
